meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Erik Siwak Hilary Carney Jon Lubin Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7105.

td.p: Erik Siwak, a writer originally from Detroit, Michigan
Hilary Carney, a rehabilitation specialist from Bonita Springs, Florida
Jon Lubin, an attorney originally from Stony Brook, New York (whose 1-day cash winnings total $15,599)

tr.td: NAMES FOR YOUR DOG
CAR TUNES
CHARLESTONS
DESIGNER INITIALS
CANADIAN INVENTORS
HETERONYMS
(Alex: Heteronyms are words that have different meanings, are pronounced differently, but are spelled the same.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'Give your male Rottweiler a strong name like Apollo or that of this supreme Greek god')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: Give your male Rottweiler a strong name like Apollo or that of this supreme Greek god

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [To Erik] No. It\'s a tributary of the Yukon. What happened in Canada in the 1890s? The Gold Rush.)
JonWhat is the St. Lawrence? Good game
$0
HilaryWhat is the Yukon River?
$12,000
ErikWhat is the Yukon?
$16,100
the Klondike River')

tr.td: NORTH AMERICAN RIVERS
At about 100 miles it's not one of Canada's 100 longest rivers, but in the 1890s it became perhaps the most famous

Hilary
Erik
